result.execSummary:
The defendant Dexter Higgins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order
Criminal Damage to Property - Domestic Abuse Repeater

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered bail on deposit NOT be applied, and RETURNED to poster.
Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including: supervision fees, and DNA & DV, and victim/witness surcharges during period of probation period, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. 
If revoked, to be paid from 24% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, collected DOC.
Restitution set at ZERO.
Obtain/maintain employment, participate in job training or participate in community service (minimum 10 hours per week).

No contact with firearms.
Court advised that due to this DV conviction under federal law, the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
Court advised that due to felony conviction, the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

No contact with victim.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.

Batterers Intervention program.
Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
Provide DNA sample.

AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dexter Higgins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dexter Higgins in court.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DOC agent Carrie Peterson also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.  mld

Defendant Dexter Higgins NOT in court.  Owen Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DOC agent Carrie Peterson also in court.
Due to a possible schedule error, upon request of DOC agent, Probation Review Hearing rescheduled to 4-10-2015 at 1:30 pm, Branch 4   mld

Defendant Dexter Higgins in court with attorney John Matthew Krejci.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded. Court reviewed and returned Certificate. Statements by parties and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 3
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 2 YEARS, credit for 47 DAYS time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEAR, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Serve 50 DAYS in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Mental Health Evaluation and Take all prescribed Medication.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim. 
-Obtain/maintain employment, participate in job training, or participate in community service (minimum 10 HOURS per WEEK).
-No contact with firearms.
-Restitution set at ZERO.
-Court ordered bail on deposit NOT be applied, and RETURNED to poster.
-Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including: supervision fees, and DNA, DV, and Victim/Witness surcharges during probation period, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. If revoked to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, collected by DOC.
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation, and Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dexter Higgins in court with attorney John Matthew Krejci.  Defendant Dexter Higgins in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS #1 and #2, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

 AS TO COUNT #3: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 11-25-2014 at 8:30 am.  The no contact order remains in full force, until further order of the Court.   mld

Discharge Summary Report from Justice Point, received and filed.
 Defendant is currently in custody since 7-2-2014, due to new charges filed.    mld

Defendant Dexter Higgins in court with attorney John Matthew Krejci.  Defendant Dexter Higgins in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 All available discovery turned over to defense counsel, per the State.  Offer received by defense counsel.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel.  Upon the motion of the State, with no objection by defense, Court ordered the following case consolidated for the purposes of trial: Case 2014CF1453 and 2014CF2891.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 10-13-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.  mld

Violation Report from Justice Point, received and filed.
-- Missed Office Contact: 7-2-2014.
-- New Arrest: 7-6-2014.

Defendant Dexter Higgins in court with attorney John M Krejci.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Final Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 7-14-2014 at 8:30 am.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date.  mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld
from the State, received and filed.  mld

14RM026164  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/16/2014

Defendant Dexter Higgins in court with attorney John M Krejci.  Defendant Dexter Higgins in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  

Defendant sworn to confirm that his true name is DEXTER SHARP (no middle name), and the correct date of birth is 3-15-1958.  

Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Officer Lawrence Tetzlaff.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss without argument heard and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Parties stipulate for purposes of this hearing that the defendant was previously convicted of domestic abuse surcharge (2012CM2251).  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-25-2014 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on 7-14-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Claudia W., Eric W., Dawn C.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dexter Higgins in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Defendant Dexter Higgins in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
